title: Workato Overview
description: An overview of Workato: recipe and connection health status as well as job performance.

definition.content:
This dashboard provides a high-level overview of Workato recipe status and job performance so you can easily spot changes in functionality and diagnose failures via error messages.

View key metrics at a glance across any or all recipes, such as: job execution rate, job duration, task count, connection failure, and more.

### Refer to the following resources for more information on the origination of this dashboard's data

-   [Workato Developer API](https://docs.workato.com/en/workato-api.html#base-url)
-   [API Client and Roles which govern the environment and projects which can be displayed](https://docs.workato.com/en/workato-api/api-clients.html#api-client-benefits)

definition.title: Change In Job Duration From Previous Week
Percentage of Recipe's Jobs Failure Rate
One Month Change in Error Types

definition.content: Job failures are assigned an error type which is a general category of error such as *Missing required field*, *Database adapter error*, *JS evaluation error*, and others.

definition.title: One Month Change in Job Failure

definition.content: Job error messages are the detailed, individual, error message related to the job failure.

Recipe and connection failures are made evident via this graph with non-zero plots. 

The offline recipe plot represents non-running recipes which may be offline due to configuration or failure. It is suggested to assign a Workato tag to any critical recipe so a monitor can alert when the recipe is offline for any reason.

Connections which are lost either because authorization has failed or the connection has failed after successful authorization. The "Active Recipes" column reports whether any running recipe is dependent on the connection. 

A Value of 1 implies failure.

Recipes which are not running due to a failure. Possible reasons include —\
`trigger_errors_limit`: Recipe was stopped due to consecutive trigger errors\
`action_quota_limit`: Customer exceeded plan's task limit\
`trial_expired`: Customer's trial expired\
`txn_quota_limit`: Customer exceeded plan's job limit

A value of 1 implies failure.
